page.title: 10A WALK IN OUR AREA
page.content: {A WALK IN OUR AREA { { We came out of St Mary's School and we turned left. We walked passed the allotments. The allotments were there from the first world war for the people to grow food. We walked on. We passed the Leith Franklin Cricket Club which was built in 1852. Then we passed the Seafeild Bowling Club which was founded in 1883. We walked on until we came to the bridge. We walked over the bridge until we could see the railway lines .Trains take goods from the docks.We could see the Firth of Forth where we saw the wreck of a ship. We could see the Scottish Agricultural Industries Building. Then we walked back off the bridge and we went into the Seafield Cemetery.
